title: Putin, Isolated and Distrustful, Leans on Handful of Hard-Line Advisers
description: Russia’s president built a power structure designed to deliver him the information he wants to hear, feeding into his miscalculations on the Ukraine war.

title: Russia Threatens to Cut Oil Output By Up to 7%
description: Moscow comments over reducing production by up to 7%, or 700,000 barrels a day, boosts global crude prices

title: Paris Shooting Kills at Least Three, With Kurdish Center Among Sites Hit
description: The attack in the heart of the French capital left at least three others injured, officials said. Police detained a suspect.

title: France and U.K. Face Wave of Strikes During Holiday Season
description: The U.K. and France braced for disruptions to holiday travel, as British border-control personnel went on strike and French rail workers walked off the job.

title: Ukraine Claims Heavy Russian Losses in South
description: Kyiv’s military said it struck near Berdyansk, while the Ukrainian mayor of Russian-occupied Melitopol reported a large, unexplained explosion there.

title: Chinese Pharmacies Struggle to Stock Medication as Covid Spreads
description: A surge in infections has triggered shortages of ibuprofen, paracetamol and other fever medication, weeks after China abandoned its three-year effort to contain the virus.

title: Taiwan to Get Loans, Not Grants, to Buy U.S. Weapons
description: Some in Congress say tight budgets doomed the grants, which supporters see as a display of U.S. backing.

title: Japan Inflation Hits Four-Decade High, Pressuring Central Bank in 2023
description: Core inflation rose at the fastest pace in nearly 41 years in November, fueling market speculation that the Bank of Japan would look to tighten monetary policy.

title: Japan to Spend Billions on U.S. Tomahawk Missiles in Military Buildup
description: The spending is part of a record defense budget approved by the cabinet equivalent to $51.4 billion for the fiscal year starting in April.
